metadata.titel_preek: The Power That Gives Up Power

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God disciplines and re-commissions a demoralized prophet by shifting his focus from pyrotechnic power to the 'still small voice' of the Word.

tekstueel_bewijs: The Lord is gentle with Elijah.
The Lord sends an angel to feed him.
The Lord has brought him on a retreat.
God gives him his new commission.

object.identificatie: The restoration and humility of the Prophet/Hearer
tekstueel_bewijs: Elijah submits to the voice of God.

zender.identificatie: The Word of God / The Promise
tekstueel_bewijs: He is present... because that is what he promised.
We may learn this lesson from Elijah today.
May we... wrap our faces in thanksgiving.

helper.identificatie: The Angel, the 'Still Small Voice', and the 'Small Voices' of the faithful
tekstueel_bewijs: The Lord sends an angel to feed him.
The steady witness of the less flamboyant members.

tegenstander.identificatie: Human Grandiosity and the Desire for Pyrotechnic Power
tekstueel_bewijs: He can’t see past his own grandiosity.
He’s a tornado-chaser; he loves pyrotechnics.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just Jezebel, but the human tendency to mistake worldly power for God's presence, which leads to despair when power fails.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The life of the believer as a 'still small voice' in the world.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer (Sunday school teachers, greeters)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program is presented as the fruit of having been 'fed' and 'commissioned' by the primary subject (God).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Still Small Voice → God ← Human Grandiosity

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Lord is gentle with Elijah.
The Lord has brought him on a retreat.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: He asked that he might die.

voorbeelden: Elijah submits to the voice of God.
He relished the whole idea of calling down fire.
There is a major lesson here about the nature of God.
The power that gives up power.
The Word of God was working in me even then.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's unique 'power' (Pouvoir) which is paradoxically found in weakness, rather than human obligation (Devoir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: God is not in the 'power' (S2) but in the 'Word' (S1), which redefines power as suffering love.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the 'fire' is recognized as a real but insufficient manifestation of God.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the primary actor who initiates the retreat, feeds the prophet, and speaks the Word. Human action is a response to God's promise.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: I see the headstones of my Sunday school teachers...

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the Subject of restoration
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The Lord is gentle with Elijah. Instead of reproaching him, the Lord sends an angel to feed him.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: Christological focus on 'Power giving up Power'
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: It is the power that offers up God’s self in suffering love.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Elijah is used as a mirror for human failure and grandiosity rather than a model to imitate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: God sustains the prophet despite his failure.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and humility; moving from the pressure of 'performing' to the peace of 'receiving'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic sanctification: God works in the believer through the Word.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the OT narrative to the Christological 'power that gives up power' is seamless.
spanning_punten: The tension between Elijah's 'perfect hatred' and Christ's 'suffering love'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He is present in the preaching... because that is what he promised.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: Endowment: The Spirit 'blows where it wills' and works through the Word.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: High: Sin is seen as 'grandiosity' and 'ceasing to trust God'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is driven by God's initiative. Elijah is the object of God's grace before he is the subject of any new mission.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The emphasis on God's promise as the source of presence is excellent.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The 'Opponent' of human grandiosity is well-developed.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God feeds Elijah) correctly precedes Ethics (Elijah anoints Elisha).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject of the narrative while addressing deep psychological and spiritual human needs.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the 'still small voice' metaphor, actantial analysis reveals that God is the one doing the 'speaking' and 'feeding', making it a grace-event rather than just a poetic idea.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the historical context of Jezebel; semiotics focuses on the functional role of 'The Opponent' as a catalyst for the Subject's (God's) intervention.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas helps see that Elijah's 'depression' is actually a modal failure (loss of Pouvoir) which only the Sender (God) can rectify through a new mandate.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids the 'Be like Elijah' trap by showing Elijah's failure as the necessary ground for God's speech.
